sa-jewish-report.name: Howard Sackstein
sa-jewish-report.bio: Longtime chairman of the SA Jewish Report, overseeing the publication's editorial direction and community engagement in South Africa.

sa-jewish-report.name: Peta Krost Maunder
sa-jewish-report.bio: Award-winning editor of the SA Jewish Report who shaped its coverage of South African Jewish community affairs for over two decades.

sa-jewish-report.name: Geoff Sifrin
sa-jewish-report.bio: Former longtime editor of the SA Jewish Report who helped establish the publication as the primary newspaper serving South African Jewry.

south-african-holocaust-and-genocide-fou.name: Tali Nates
south-african-holocaust-and-genocide-fou.bio: Daughter of Holocaust survivors who founded the Johannesburg Holocaust & Genocide Centre and directs the SAHGF, championing Holocaust education across South Africa.

south-african-holocaust-and-genocide-fou.name: Richard sobel
south-african-holocaust-and-genocide-fou.bio: Served on the foundation's board of trustees, supporting governance and strategic direction of Holocaust memorialization in South Africa.

south-african-holocaust-and-genocide-fou.name: Marlene Silbert
south-african-holocaust-and-genocide-fou.bio: Trustee of the SAHGF who has been instrumental in promoting genocide awareness and educational programming.

naspers.name: Koos Bekker
naspers.bio: Transformed Naspers from a South African media company into a global tech investor, most notably through the early investment in Tencent that generated enormous returns.

naspers.name: Bob van Dijk
naspers.bio: Served as CEO of Naspers and Prosus until 2023, overseeing the company's global internet and e-commerce portfolio including investments in Tencent and Delivery Hero.

naspers.name: Ton Vosloo
naspers.bio: Served as chairman of Naspers and played a pivotal role in the company's transition from Afrikaans-language media to a diversified global technology and media group.

naspers.name: Cobus Stofberg
naspers.bio: Key figure in the launch of M-Net, South Africa's first private subscription television service under the Naspers umbrella.

naspers.name: Phuti Mahanyele-Dabengwa
naspers.bio: Led Naspers's South African operations, overseeing its media, e-commerce, and technology interests in the domestic market.

south-african-jewish-board-of-deputies.name: Wendy Kahn
south-african-jewish-board-of-deputies.bio: Serves as national director of the SAJBD, the representative body of South African Jewry, leading its advocacy and community relations work.

south-african-jewish-board-of-deputies.name: Mary Kluk
south-african-jewish-board-of-deputies.bio: Longtime national president of the SAJBD, representing the South African Jewish community in civic affairs and combating antisemitism.

south-african-jewish-board-of-deputies.name: Zev Krengel
south-african-jewish-board-of-deputies.bio: Vice president of the SAJBD who has played a key role in the organization's interfaith dialogue and media engagement.

south-african-jewish-board-of-deputies.name: Shaun Zagnoev
south-african-jewish-board-of-deputies.bio: Served as vice president of the SAJBD, contributing to its governance and community advocacy initiatives.

cape-town-holocaust-and-genocide-centre.name: Richard sobel
cape-town-holocaust-and-genocide-centre.bio: Served in a leadership capacity at the Cape Town Holocaust and Genocide Centre, overseeing its educational programs and exhibitions.

cape-town-holocaust-and-genocide-centre.name: Dianne sobel
cape-town-holocaust-and-genocide-centre.bio: Led the educational programming at the Cape Town Holocaust and Genocide Centre, developing curricula for schools across the Western Cape.

cape-town-holocaust-and-genocide-centre.name: Myra sobel
cape-town-holocaust-and-genocide-centre.bio: Founding patron of the Cape Town Holocaust and Genocide Centre, dedicated to preserving Holocaust memory in South Africa.

chief-rabbi-of-south-africa.name: Warren Goldstein
chief-rabbi-of-south-africa.bio: Serves as Chief Rabbi of South Africa since 2005, known for the Shabbos Project initiative that has spread globally and for his public advocacy on moral issues.

chief-rabbi-of-south-africa.name: Cyril Harris
chief-rabbi-of-south-africa.bio: British-born Chief Rabbi of South Africa who was a prominent anti-apartheid voice and close associate of Nelson Mandela, serving the community until his retirement.

chief-rabbi-of-south-africa.name: Louis Rabinowitz
chief-rabbi-of-south-africa.bio: Served as Chief Rabbi of the Transvaal and later of South Africa, noted for his scholarship and leadership during the post-war growth of the community.

chief-rabbi-of-south-africa.name: Bernard Casper
chief-rabbi-of-south-africa.bio: Served as Chief Rabbi of South Africa for over two decades, guiding the Jewish community through turbulent apartheid-era politics.

liberty-group-donald-gordon.name: Donald Gordon
liberty-group-donald-gordon.bio: South African Jewish businessman who founded Liberty Life in 1957 and built it into one of Africa's largest insurance and financial services groups.
